result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

JusticePoint Status Report, filed.

Defendant Ricardo S Roman in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Ricardo S Roman.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties continue with negotiations and requested a new projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 11.  Court reviewed the Justice Point report with defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-15-2022.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.

Defendant Ricardo S Roman in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin..  Case in court for scheduled plea and sentencing.  Parties have not completed negotiations.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25 with co-defendant case 22CM667.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

JusticePoint Status Report dated June 10, 2022 - received
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ricardo S Roman in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Case called with co-defendant case.
Prior to case being called on the record, defense counsel filed request for substitution.
Defense counsel advises Court he is withdrawing the request for substitution.

Arraignment held.
Defendant was arraigned in open court and defense counsel entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.
Defense counsel advises Court there may be a resolution to the case prior to trial.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ricardo S Roman in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Ricardo S Roman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ricardo S Roman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:
